lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qwq mwq giH jnmq suq Gny skl n hoq smsr gun gQ jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Taat Maat Grih Janamat Sout Ghanay , Sakal N Hot Samasar Goun Gad Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as several sons are born to a parent, but all are not virtuous to the same extent.

lines.gurmukhi: ctIAw Anyk jYsy AwvYN ctswl ibKY pVq n eyksy srb hr kQ jI
lines.transliteration_english: Chateeaa Anayk Jaisay Aavain Chatasaal Bikhai , Parhat N Aykasay Sarab Har Kad Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as there are several students in a school, but all of them are not proficient in understanding a subject to the same extent.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ndI nwv imil bYTq Anyk pMQI hoq n smwn sBY clq hYN pQ jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Nadee Naav Mili Baitthat Anayk Pandee , Hot N Samaan Sabhai Chalat Hain Pad Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as several passengers travel in a boat, but all of them have different destinations. Everyone goes his own way 00 leaving the boat.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crn srn hYN Anyk isK siqgur krn kwrn smrQ jI ]583]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Charan Saran Hain Anayk Sikha , Satigur Karan Kaaran Samarad Jee ?583?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, several Sikhs of different aptitude take refuge of the True Guru, but the cause of all causes--the capable True Guru makes them alike by bestowing on them the elixir of Naam.  (583)
